<h1 style="text-align:left; color:#003f63;">About Me</h1>


<!-- Professional Summary -->
<p style="font-size:18px; line-height:1.7; color:#333;">
 <strong>Dr. S.V. Balasubramanian</strong> is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the <strong>Department of Biology</strong> at the <strong>University of Massachusetts Boston</strong>, USA.  
He specializes in <strong>ocean color remote sensing, aquatic optics, hyperspectral imaging,</strong> and the use of <strong>machine learning</strong> for aquatic environmental monitoring.
</p>
    
<p style="font-size:18px; line-height:1.7; color:#333; margin-top:20px;">
Dr. Balasubramanian has over a decade of research experience in <strong>satellite remote sensing, optical modeling, and data-driven environmental analysis</strong>.He has worked at leading institutions including <strong>NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC)</strong>, <strong>GESTAR-II/UMBC</strong>, and <strong>IIT Madras</strong>.His work bridges <strong>field observations</strong>, <strong>satellite product validation</strong>, and <strong>AI-based modeling frameworks</strong> for complex aquatic systems.
</p>

<!-- Research Interests -->
<h2 style="color:#003f63; margin-top:30px;">Research Interests</h2>
<ul style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.7; color:#003f63;">
  <li>Ocean color remote sensing and optical property retrieval</li>
  <li>Machine and deep learning for aquatic environment monitoring</li>
  <li>Hyperspectral data analysis and uncertainty quantification</li>
  <li>Atmospheric correction and bio-optical modeling</li>
  <li>Integration of UAV, field, and satellite observations</li>
</ul>
